text.title: part5_Billy West, voice of Ren and Stimpy, Futurama, on the rough start that shaped his life
text.p:
BW :
Sure . That ’s what I mean about some people having naturally quirky voices . You ’ve heard people in your life , like you meet a girl , a full-grown woman , who goes [
in high pitched squeal
] , “ I wanted to ask you . ” And you go , ' Drop the act . Is this a put-on ? ' And I go , “ Shit , you should be doing cartoons ! ”
text.head: " It was a horror chamber where I grew up "

p.hi:
DS : Is how you developed your talent when you were younger based upon imitating others ? You would hear things that would leave impressions on you and you would want to imitate them ? But
why
would you want to imitate them ?

text.p:
BW :
Because I had no role models . My dad was a certifiable
psycho
and he made my life a living hell and it was a horror chamber where I grew up and when I grew up . The guy used to
beat the daylights out of me
left and right , for any random reason . He was a raving
alchie
. I grew up with him making fun of me . I was forced to retreat into a world where I could n’t get hurt or beat up or anything like that .

p.hi: — Billy West on beginning to do voices

text.p:
BW :
Well yeah . You gotta understand , it was like I was a little kid . I ’m not a magical being . My dad tried to kill me about fifteen times .

p.hi: DS : So when you would escape into those voices , you felt a sense of safety ?

text.p:
BW :
Yes . ' Cause I was surrounded by things that would n’t be a threat to me .

p.hi: DS : And things that you could control through your own voice .
DS : Whereas you could n’t control what an alcoholic authority figure was going to do .

text.p:
BW :
I was like an alien ; I was an observation unit , trying to study the human condition , not consciously , but because I had to . I could tell you the kind of night I was going to have from the sound of the key in the door or the way the car pulled up . I was hyper vigilant . So all I was , was this unit from space that had nothing but data gathering and sensory equipment .

p.hi: DS : What was your dad ’s reaction to your doing voices ?

text.p:
BW :
It did n’t register on the radar because , number one , I was n’t really doing it in the time I spent with him . The other thing was that he was a frustrated talent . He could sit down at the
piano
and just start playing it , having no lessons or training . He could do dialogs and he could do voices . He was very funny , you know , among his friends and all that . He was also a musician , a drummer . And I became a musician except I was n’t a
drummer
, I was a
guitar player
. The thing is , he could never make it pay . All he had was a string of jobs . Driving a beer truck then driving a soda pop truck then driving an ice cream truck . You know what I mean ? Like a
Ralph Kramden
kind of thing .
